channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About the Boulder, Colorado, Attack and Suspect
item.description: Eight people in Boulder, Colo., were burned after a man threw Molotov cocktails in an attack that he had planned for a year, the authorities said.

item.title: Treasury head Scott Bessent says Jamie Dimon should relax about the bond markets: ‘For his entire career he’s made predictions…none of them have come true’
item.description: Rising interest rates on U.S. debt seem to back up Dimon’s concern about government spending, but the Treasury secretary says it’s not as bad as it se...

item.title: New York City’s Pride organizers are racing to fill a fundraising gap as PepsiCo, Nissan, and others retreat from DEI policies
item.description: Many U.S. corporations this year stopped supporting Pride events that celebrate LGBTQ+ culture and rights.

item.title: What if Google Just Broke Itself Up? A Tech Insider Makes the Case.
item.description: Prosecutors aren’t the only ones arguing for a smaller Google. Some critics say it might be better for investors, customers and innovation.

item.title: Why Politics Feels So Cruel Right Now
item.description: Three Opinion writers on the death of empathy in America.

item.title: Ex-CEO of addiction-treatment center network charged with targeting journalists, including spray-painting their homes and throwing bricks through their windows
item.description: Eric Spofford, the founder and former CEO of Granite Recovery Centers, allegedly paid his friend $20,000 to vandalize their homes.

item.title: What you need to know about Moderna’s new COVID vaccine, just approved by the FDA
item.description: The shot had previously been approved for everyone 12 and older. Now, there are limits.

item.title: Mark Cuban says consumers may actually see lower prices due to tariff uncertainty as companies deal with the aftermath of stockpiling goods
item.description: “The variance in tariffs has made it impossible to know how to manage costs,” Cuban said on social media. “So you do all you can to clear out inventor...

item.title: Consumers Are Financing Their Groceries. What Does It Say About the Economy?
item.description: Increased use of “buy now, pay later” loans may signal shifting consumer habits, but could also be a troubling sign of financial stress.

item.title: In Drone Attacks on Russia, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
item.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

item.title: German Border Police Barred From Rejecting Asylum Seekers Arriving From E.U. Nations Without Review
item.description: A Berlin court ruled that officials must investigate the claims of those arriving from neighboring E.U. countries, dealing a blow to the government’s ...

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.description: The suspect, Mohamed Sabry Soliman, had arrived in 2022 on a tourist visa from Egypt and stayed after the visa expired, an official said. Eight people...

item.title: What imports the U.S. relies on most from each country.
item.description: The item from each country that makes up the largest American import share.

item.title: In Drone Attacks on Russia, Ukraine Aims for Strategic and Symbolic Blow
item.description: While the full extent of the damage is still unknown, the operation shows how Kyiv has been able to adapt and evolve over the war using drones.

item.title: Witnesses Describe Shooting Near Gaza Aid Center
item.description: Palestinians at an aid distribution center in southern Gaza came under fire on Sunday and it was not immediately clear who was responsible. An Israeli...
